intro: Erucastrum obtusangulum var. subpinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
